resources.string: Welcome in Egypt Tour Guide App!

Is a place that includes at least 120 thousand pieces of ancient Egyptian antiques, which is one of the most important attractions of Cairo, and consists of two floors are the ground and the first, and the ground floor contains a wide range of papyrus and coins used by the ancient Egyptians, The first floor contains antiques from the ancient Egyptian dynasties and contains many artifacts from the Valley of the Kings. It includes parts of the tomb of Tutankhamun, as well as the chamber of the Mamiyot, which contains 27 royal mummies from the Pharaonic era.
Cairo - Tahrir Square - Salim Hassan Street

It is one of the oldest mosques in Cairo. It was founded by Ahmed Ibn Tulun, the Abbasid ruler in Egypt, who ordered it between 867 and 879 AD. The mosque was built around a courtyard with one hall covered with four sides. The minaret contains a rear staircase. Part of a global film by James Bond is the spy who loved me inside the mosque.

Is the largest and oldest religious sites and represents the joint achievement of many generations of Egyptian builders. It consists of 3 temples, the main temple, small temples and temples. The most famous place in Karnak is the Great Hall of the Pillars, 5000 square meters It has 134 columns arranged in 16 rows.
North of Luxor, located in southern Egypt.

The tombs of kings and nobles were built in the new Kingdom and contain rooms and tombs ranging from small pits to complex tombs. The walls are decorated with scenes from Egyptian legends and show information about the funerary beliefs and rites of the period.
